data.name: Base64Tests_TestAction.SqlScript
data.value:
/* Add SQL statements here to exercise the database object that you want to test.
To test a stored procedure, invoke it here by adding an EXEC statement that has appropriate parameters.
In the lower pane, you can add test conditions that verify whether the results of your SQL statements match what you expect. */
DECLARE @rawText nvarchar(max) = N'Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Vestibulum laoreet, enim sed venenatis elementum, velit neque fermentum nulla, sit amet eleifend libero sapien eu erat. Etiam blandit ullamcorper justo ultrices ullamcorper. Class aptent taciti sociosqu ad litora torquent per conubia nostra, per inceptos himenaeos. Nulla convallis tortor id varius mattis. Phasellus aliquam feugiat lectus et maximus. Suspendisse non urna erat. Suspendisse potenti. Ut rutrum tortor non neque suscipit commodo. Mauris scelerisque nulla eu pharetra tempor. Suspendisse et consectetur felis. Donec tincidunt, purus ut volutpat placerat, lacus erat accumsan nibh, non fermentum dolor ante in sapien. Duis eget orci ligula. Sed eu velit odio. Aliquam eu erat est. Sed interdum augue vel elit molestie, at euismod dui pharetra. Cras hendrerit rhoncus congue. Curabitur vel commodo nisl, ac egestas urna. Quisque quis ante quis turpis posuere finibus vitae in magna. Nulla rhoncus, purus ut vehicula scelerisque, velit nulla pharetra ante, ut blandit erat sem in odio. Ut nec nisl laoreet, finibus nulla non, consectetur velit. Nam mollis turpis vel congue tincidunt. Proin elementum luctus sapien, vitae sodales felis. Sed maximus, ligula a condimentum congue, metus nulla imperdiet dui, vel facilisis justo tellus vel elit. Nulla elit risus, maximus nec mollis vitae, aliquam nec metus.'
DECLARE @base64 nvarchar(max), @base64Null nvarchar(max), @base64Empty nvarchar(max)
DECLARE @text nvarchar(max), @textNull nvarchar(max), @textEmpty nvarchar(max)
SELECT @base64 = clr.xfnToBase64(convert(varbinary(max), @rawText)) , @base64Null = clr.xfnToBase64(convert(varbinary(max), NULL)) , @base64Empty = clr.xfnToBase64(convert(varbinary(max), ''))
SELECT @text = convert(varchar(max), clr.xfnFromBase64(@base64)) ,@textNull = convert(varchar(max), clr.xfnFromBase64(NULL)) ,@textEmpty = convert(varchar(max), clr.xfnFromBase64(''))
SELECT CASE WHEN @text = @rawText THEN 1 ELSE 0 END, CASE WHEN @textNull IS NULL THEN 1 ELSE 0 END, CASE WHEN @textEmpty IS NULL THEN 1 ELSE 0 END, CASE WHEN @base64Null IS NULL THEN 1 ELSE 0 END, CASE WHEN @base64Null IS NULL THEN 1 ELSE 0 END

data.name: BetterQuoteNameTests_TestAction.SqlScript
data.value:
/* Add SQL statements here to exercise the database object that you want to test.
To test a stored procedure, invoke it here by adding an EXEC statement that has appropriate parameters.
In the lower pane, you can add test conditions that verify whether the results of your SQL statements match what you expect. */
SELECT QuoteName('dbo.TABLE_NAME'), -- example of old broken behavior clr.xfnBetterQuoteName('dbo.TABLE_NAME tbl'), clr.xfnBetterQuoteName('dbo.OBJECT_NAME As OBJECT_ALIAS'), [FieldList1] = clr.xfnBetterQuoteName('Column1, Column2, Column3, Column4, Column5, Column6, ;here is my sql injection; --'), [FieldList2] = clr.xfnBetterQuoteName('tbl.Column1, tbl.Column2, tbl.Column3'), [FieldList3] = clr.xfnBetterQuoteName('dbname.tbl.Column1, dbname.tbl.Column2, tbl.Column3'), clr.xfnBetterQuoteName('dbo.OBJECT_NAME OBJECT_ALIAS'), clr.xfnBetterQuoteName(NULL), clr.xfnBetterQuoteName('')

data.name: FormatStringNTests_TestAction.SqlScript
data.value:
/* Add SQL statements here to exercise the database object that you want to test.
To test a stored procedure, invoke it here by adding an EXEC statement that has appropriate parameters.
In the lower pane, you can add test conditions that verify whether the results of your SQL statements match what you expect. */
SELECT clr.xfnFormatString3(N'This is arg 0:({0}), arg 1:({1}), and arg 2 as a date: ({2:yyyy-MM-dd}), and arg 2 as a time: ({2:HH:mm:ss:fff})', 'foo', 'bar', cast('2015-07-27 13:05:10.478' AS datetime))
SELECT clr.xfnFormatString6(N'Name:{0}; Number:{1}; Type:{2}; Low:{3}; High:{4}; Status:{5}', sv.name, sv.number, sv.type, sv.low, sv.high, sv.status) --SELECT sv.name, sv.number, sv.type, sv.low, sv.high, sv.status FROM master.dbo.spt_values sv WHERE sv.type = 'P'

data.name: FormatTests_TestAction.SqlScript
data.value:
/* Add SQL statements here to exercise the database object that you want to test.
To test a stored procedure, invoke it here by adding an EXEC statement that has appropriate parameters.
In the lower pane, you can add test conditions that verify whether the results of your SQL statements match what you expect. */
SELECT clr.xfnFormat('2015-07-27 09:42:26.1552697', 'MM/dd/yyyy'), clr.xfnFormat('2015-07-27 09:42:26.1552697', 'yyyy-MM-dd'), clr.xfnFormat('1234.4321', '##,###.00'), clr.xfnFormat('1234', '##,###.00'), clr.xfnFormat(null, '##,###.00')

data.name: PadTests_TestAction.SqlScript
data.value:
/* Add SQL statements here to exercise the database object that you want to test.
To test a stored procedure, invoke it here by adding an EXEC statement that has appropriate parameters.
In the lower pane, you can add test conditions that verify whether the results of your SQL statements match what you expect. */
SELECT clr.xfnPadLeft('9999', '0', 10), clr.xfnPadRight('9999', '0', 10), clr.xfnPadLeft(null, '0', 10), clr.xfnPadRight(null, '0', 10), clr.xfnPadLeft('9999', '0', 4), clr.xfnPadRight('9999', '0', 4), clr.xfnPadLeft('', '0', 4), clr.xfnPadRight('', '0', 4)

data.name: ProperCasesTests_TestAction.SqlScript
data.value:
/* Add SQL statements here to exercise the database object that you want to test.
To test a stored procedure, invoke it here by adding an EXEC statement that has appropriate parameters.
In the lower pane, you can add test conditions that verify whether the results of your SQL statements match what you expect. */
SELECT clr.xfnProperCase('john doe'), clr.xfnProperCase(null), clr.xfnProperCase('')

data.name: StringCountAndIndexTests_TestAction.SqlScript
data.value:
/* Add SQL statements here to exercise the database object that you want to test.
To test a stored procedure, invoke it here by adding an EXEC statement that has appropriate parameters.
In the lower pane, you can add test conditions that verify whether the results of your SQL statements match what you expect. */
SELECT clr.xfnCountString('Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet? Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet?', 'ipsum'), clr.xfnCountString(null, 'ipsum'), clr.xfnCountString('', 'ipsum')
SELECT clr.xfnIndexOf('Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet? Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet?', 'ipsum'), clr.xfnIndexOf(null, 'ipsum'), clr.xfnIndexOf('', 'ipsum')
SELECT clr.xfnLastIndexOf('Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet? Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet?', 'ipsum'), clr.xfnLastIndexOf(null, 'ipsum'), clr.xfnLastIndexOf('', 'ipsum')
SELECT clr.xfnNthIndexOf('Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet? Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet?', 'ipsum', 1), clr.xfnNthIndexOf('Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet? Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet?', 'ipsum', 2), clr.xfnNthIndexOf('Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet? Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet?', 'ipsum', 3), clr.xfnNthIndexOf(null, 'ipsum', 1)

data.name: TryParseTests_TestAction.SqlScript
data.value:
/* Add SQL statements here to exercise the database object that you want to test.
To test a stored procedure, invoke it here by adding an EXEC statement that has appropriate parameters.
In the lower pane, you can add test conditions that verify whether the results of your SQL statements match what you expect. */
SELECT clr.xfnTryParseToInt('123', 0), clr.xfnTryParseToInt('123a', 1), clr.xfnTryParseToInt(null, 2), clr.xfnTryParseToInt(null, 3), clr.xfnTryParseToInt('', 4), clr.xfnTryParseToInt('', 5)
SELECT clr.xfnTryParseToDbl('123.45', 0), clr.xfnTryParseToDbl('123.45a', 1.1), clr.xfnTryParseToDbl(null, 1.2), clr.xfnTryParseToDbl(null, 1.3), clr.xfnTryParseToDbl('', 1.4), clr.xfnTryParseToDbl('', 1.5)
